title: Implement GET /api/sites/[siteSlug]/categories API
body:
## Description
Implement the GET /api/sites/[siteSlug]/categories API endpoint according to the specification in `specs/api/categories/GET_categories.md`.

## Requirements
- Retrieve all categories for a given site slug
- Handle test environment by using appropriate key prefixes
- Ensure proper error handling for individual category fetch failures
- Sort categories in a logical order (e.g., by the `order` field)
- Include category hierarchy information through the `parentId` field
- Implement proper tenant isolation for admin access
- Provide appropriate public access for frontend rendering

## Acceptance Criteria
- API endpoint follows the specification exactly
- Categories are returned in the correct order
- Hierarchical relationships are preserved
- Proper error handling is implemented
- Tenant isolation is enforced for admin access
- Public access is properly supported
- Unit tests cover all scenarios in the specification
- Integration tests verify the API works end-to-end

## Related Specifications
- `specs/api/categories/GET_categories.md`

title: Implement GET /api/sites/[siteSlug]/categories/[categoryId] API
body:
## Description
Implement the GET /api/sites/[siteSlug]/categories/[categoryId] API endpoint according to the specification in `specs/api/categories/GET_category_by_id.md`.

## Requirements
- Retrieve a single category by ID
- Validate the category belongs to the specified site
- Return complete category data
- Properly handle non-existent categories or sites
- Implement tenant isolation (for administrative access)
- Validate site exists before attempting to fetch category

## Acceptance Criteria
- API endpoint follows the specification exactly
- Category data is returned correctly
- Site-category relationship is validated
- Proper error handling is implemented
- Tenant isolation is enforced for admin access
- Public access is properly supported
- Unit tests cover all scenarios in the specification
- Integration tests verify the API works end-to-end
